intro: Malaxis longidens, commonly known as the long-stemmed Malaxis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in a raceme. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in shaded, moist habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and specific ecological requirements, it is often cultivated in greenhouses or specialized botanical gardens.
